climbs.name: Slick Slab
climbs.fa: 90's TR, Mark Mellot 2021 boulder - maybe others

content.description: "With modern crashpads this former top-rope climb makes for a wonderful highball slab. Start in the middle of the slab and figure a way to go roughly straight up, eventually topping out on the pinnacle of the face. Getting off the ground is the physical challenge, and those who meet the task will face the mental trial: a last commiting sequence with 6 feet to the lip. Luckily there is a option to bail out right for those who get cold feet. Obviously this was not a first ascent, and maybe not the first ascent without a rope. Possibly the first ascent in true bouldering style: working ground up. Extra points if you don't scout the top out." -Mark Mellot
content.location: Start slightly to the right of the middle of the boulder

content.description: right leaning line on the right side of the boulder. Climbs up into the downclimb. Using crimps and slick feet in the seem to get up and to the right to the ledge.
content.location: starts on crimps in the seem on the right side

climbs.name: Blockhead (Sit)
climbs.fa: Chris G, Owen A, Jordan J

content.description: Start down low both hands on the arete and a good foot to your left, trick your way into the stand start, to your left, with holds on the arete and face. Lunge from jucy pinch to juicy pinch and to an invisible crimp. Head left to a good sidepull for a airy topout. Fall off the down climb into the manzanita for full value.
content.location: Start with both hands on the arete V-small holds but V-positive

content.description: Stand Start on a juicy pinch and opposition on the arete. Lunge to a pinch and then to an invisible crimp trending right towards a good sidepull for an airy topout.Origional TR start.
Highball slabs and jucy aretes to satisfy your taste for chise blocks
